fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61386].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Granting permissions in JIRA is currently a tedious process as users need to pick one by one the permissions in the drop down menu. This makes the process prone to errors as permissions need to be chosen manually.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a way to have a list of permissions with checkboxes so that users could just pick the ones that they want to grant for any other users.
fields.summary: Implement permission list for granting permissions

h2.Summary
Issue creation returns error due to post function not able to set the Epic Link field.

h2.Investigation

Error is returned when issue is attempted to be created.

{noformat}
We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file.
{noformat}

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Go to a JIRA Software project workflow.
# Add a post function to update custom field.
# Look for Epic Link and for value key in an Epic Link name or ID.
# Try to create a ticket from the same project.

h2.Expected Result
Issue created with updated Epic Link field.

h2.Current Result
Issue is not created and error is returned.
fields.summary: Post Function to set Epic Link field on issue creation returns error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When JIRA Software is upgraded or installed, it can cause JIRA to become unresponsive if there are a huge number _Field Configurations_ with large number of _Custom Fields_ while it iterates through them all, restoring and locking CustomField which belongs to Agile. Problem is a factor of #Field_Configurations * #Custom_Fields_per_Configuration * #Agile_Fields
h3. Environment
 * Large instance > 1k Custom fields and > 500 Field Configurations (FieldLayouts)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Install JIRA Software onto an instance with a huge number of custom fields.
h3. Expected Results

It installs without any problems.
h3. Actual Results

JIRA becomes unresponsive while it goes through and restores and locks fields. If generating thread dumps or profiling the below stack trace will be present:

h3. Notes

On a larger instance when left over the weekend it took several days to finish locking and restoring the fields. After they were locked and restored following starts of JIRA Software proceeding without any problems.
h5. Related

Problem is caused by two factors:
 * Slow population of FieldLayout cache, see related JRA-29310
{code:java}
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.AbstractFieldLayoutManager.loadFieldLayoutItems(AbstractFieldLayoutManager.java:347)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.AbstractFieldLayoutManager.loadFieldLayout(AbstractFieldLayoutManager.java:390)
...
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache$DelegatingLoadingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:264)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.AbstractFieldLayoutManager.getRelevantFieldLayout(AbstractFieldLayoutManager.java:301)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.DefaultFieldLayoutManager.getEditableFieldLayouts(DefaultFieldLayoutManager.java:256)
...
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.issue.fields.ManagedFieldConfigurationRestorerImpl.restoreFieldConfiguration(ManagedFieldConfigurationRestorerImpl.java:185)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.issue.fields.ManagedFieldConfigurationRestorerImpl.restoreField(ManagedFieldConfigurationRestorerImpl.java:134)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.issue.fields.ManagedFieldConfigurationRestorerImpl.restoreAndLockField(ManagedFieldConfigurationRestorerImpl.java:106)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.issue.fields.ManagedFieldConfigurationRestorerImpl.restoreAndLockFields(ManagedFieldConfigurationRestorerImpl.java:74)
....
{code}

 * Updating of FieldLayouts is expensive, as per JRA-62242.

h3. Workaround

Update the field layout descriptions prior to running the upgrade.

(!) As with any direct database changes we recommend to fully test this in a staging environment and take a backup of production prior to running any of the following steps.
 - Stop JIRA
 - Run the following 2 queries:

The following query will update FieldLayoutItem descriptions to the new naming convention.
{code:java}
UPDATE fieldlayoutitem
SET
  description = replace(description, 'JIRA Agile', 'JIRA Software')
WHERE description LIKE '%JIRA Agile%';
{code}
Update descriptions on the custom fields themselves.
{code:java}
UPDATE customfield
SET
  description = replace(description, 'JIRA Agile', 'JIRA Software')
WHERE description LIKE '%JIRA Agile%';
{code}
 - Proceed with upgrade as normal.
fields.summary: JIRA Software can become unresponsive on upgrade or install when there are many custom fields due to restoring and locking all fields

h3. Summary

FieldValidationException on URL custom field with no default value after having a default value.
h3. Environment
 * Jira 7.1
 * Jira 6.4.7 and 6.4.13

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA 7.1.x using default values.
 # Create a new custom field of type URL field.
 # Populate the custom field with a default value: [https://support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com/] but any link will work.
 # Remove the default value by clicking "Edit Default Value, removing the text and then clicking the "Set Default" button.
 # Then see this exception in the atlassian-jira.log.
 # Click create an issue and see two exceptions in the atlassian-jira.log.
 # Finish creating an issue and see two simular exceptions as above in the atlassian-jira.log.

Before adding a default value, there are no rows in genericconfiguration. After adding the value then deleting it, there is a row in my test instance:
{code:sql}
10500 | DefaultValue | 10903   | <string></string>
{code}
I have confirmed that these steps work to reproduce the issue in JIRA 6.4.7 and 6.4.13 as listed in JRA-35222. The missing step to reproduce this issue in JRA-35222 was to have a value set and then deleted.

This issue has no known issues that it creates. The only affect known at this time is the logs.
h3. Expected Results

I would not expect to have these logs.

h3. Workaround
 # Backup Jira
 # Stop Jira
 # Find the culprit field with the following SQL query
{code:sql}
select GC.id as "GenericConfiguration ID",CF.cfname as "Custom Field Name" 
from genericconfiguration GC
join fieldconfiguration FC on GC.datakey = cast(FC.id as varchar)
join customfield CF on FC.fieldid = concat('customfield_',cast(CF.id as varchar))
where xmlvalue = '<string></string>'
and customfieldtypekey = 'com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:url';
{code}

 # Delete the problematic rows from genericconfiguration
{code:sql}
delete from genericconfiguration where id in (select GC.id 
from genericconfiguration GC
join fieldconfiguration FC on GC.datakey = cast(FC.id as varchar)
join customfield CF on FC.fieldid = concat('customfield_',cast(CF.id as varchar))
where xmlvalue = '<string></string>'
and customfieldtypekey = 'com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:url');
{code}

 # Restart JIRA.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61381].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When resizing your browser window to make it smaller, the title expands vertically to respond to the smaller width of the browser. 

The problem is that while it expands vertically, the text doesn't make full use of the horizontal space, leaving white space on the sides and causing the title to expand vertically more than it needs to.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud v 1000.35.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Search Issues page in JIRA
# Minimize browser width

h3. Expected Results
# Be able to make browser smaller and have the title be responsive as it currently is, but make use of the full available white space on the sides

h3. Actual Results
Title is squished more than needed, leaving white space on sides

h3.Workaround
Expand the browser window so title fits horizontally
fields.summary: Title does not make use of available horizontal space in detail view
Diversify Default User Avatar Selection

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61378].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
The JIRA REST API is peculiar and picky about date and time strings. It's _almost_ [ISO 8601|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601] compliant, but slightly different:
* It demands time zone offsets in the form \[\+\-\]hhmm instead of the ISO format, \[\+\-\]hh:mm.
* It fails to parse if there is no fractional seconds, even if that fraction is 0 (e.g. {{2016-06-08T23:44:57+0000}} is not accepted while {{2016-06-08T23:44:57.00+0000}} is).

These differences, while subtle,  break compatibility with standard date/time libraries, requiring the user to "fix up" library-provided strings before POSTing them to JIRA. Even worse, instead of returning HTTP 400 and indicating the error as some message (as the API docs say JIRA should), POSTs to {{/rest/api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey\}/worklog}} (and possibly other endpoints) return HTTP 500 if JIRA is unsatisfied with the date, giving no indication of what went wrong.

*To Reproduce:*
POST to {{/rest/api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey\}/worklog}} to a "started" value of some ISO 8601 date and time, e.g. {{2016-06-08T23:44:57+00:00}}

*Desired Fixes:*
# The JIRA API should accept date and time strings in standard ISO 8601 formats.
# When times cannot be parsed, HTTP 400 should be returned instead of a HTTP 500 "Internal Server Error"
fields.summary: REST API parses date/time strings poorly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61376].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JIRA, users can create duplicate custom fields. This is a problem because if a user creates a custom field with the same name as a default JIRA field and adds it to screens, it can make reporting in JIRA and in Portfolio inaccurate. An example field is *Story Points*. A user could create any number of *Story Points* fields and associate them with screens, but Portfolio will only read the field with the default field ID and thus, Story Points will not populate in Portfolio.

Duplicate fields can also cause other issues and confusion for site administrators. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 Prevent users from creating duplicate custom fields or at the very least display warning messages about custom fields being created with the same name as default JIRA fields. 

An issue could arise where this solution would prevent users from importing projects because their projects have the same field name as a field already in existence in the destination instance. This could be worked around by renaming those fields in the source instance.
fields.summary: Prevent duplicate field creation

h3. Summary
[Installing JIRA data center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/installing-jira-data-center-604274940.html] has instuctions on how to upgrade yoru existing JIRA Instance to data center.  It does not document where the licence change occurs.
h3. Environment
* Currently running JIRA Server.
* Upgrading JIRA to Data Center.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Follow instructions in [Installing JIRA data center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/installing-jira-data-center-604274940.html].  Go to Section 3 Configure your existing JIRA instance to work in a cluster.
# A restart in this section is implied.
# After restart, a screen is displayed that shows when to enter in the licence.
# Then the screen directs another reboot.

h3. Expected Results
These are the expected results.

h3. Actual Results
The actual results are that if someone is planning an upgrade to Data Center, the point where the licence change is not straightforward.

The Data Center licences is rejected when running JIRA as a standalone instance.  

A note about these screens, and directly calling these instructions as migration instructions, would mitigate customer confusion and assist in training new agents. 

h3.Workaround
The workaround is to follow the instructions without knowing the expected results.
fields.summary: Documentation does not state where licence change happens

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary

In [Configuring attachment settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Configuring+file+attachments] screen in the product, there is the description saying "The total upload size limit of attachments." in *Attachment Size* field.
 !configure-attachment-size.png|thumbnail! 

First we think "The total upload size" means the total size limit of attachments per issue literally. But this is actually for setting max file size per attachment. This description is really misleading.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Any environment as this appears as application message in product UI

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Choose the cog icon in header,  then choose "System" under "JIRA ADMINISTRATION "
# Choose "Attachements" in the left-hand panel.
# You can see the description "The total upload size limit of attachments." in "Attachment Size" field, and the default value is set as 10.00 MB.
# When upload attachement files in a issue, I can upload many files with size 5MB, 6MB, 9.9MB. But I cannot upload a file over 10.00MB. So it's not right what "The total upload size" at 3. 

h3. Expected Results

The description at 3 should be corrected like "The upload size limit of an attachment." 
Or JIRA user should be able to upload attachments  files up to 10MB per issue. 

h3. Actual Results

JIRA user can upload many files over 10MB unless each attachiment file is not over 10MB.
 
h3. Notes

Need to confirm the original specification.

h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Description of Attachement Size filed in configuring attachement UI  is misleading

Per [JIRA Documentation Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ALLDOC/JIRA+Documentation+Directory], XML Exports of the JIRA Documentation used to be available until JIRA 7, which allowed for importing to a local Confluence instance. h3. Summary

After changing the *Menu Item Highlight Text Color*	in the [Look and Feel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRACloud/Configuring+the+look+and+feel+of+your+JIRA+applications] settings in JIRA, when selecting an assignee from an issue, the highlighted text is still the default color (white) for the unbolded characters. 

h3. Environment
Tested on JIRA Server 7.1.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Look and Feel settings.
# Change the Menu Item Highlight Text Color to something other than white ex. Green.
# Create/go to a ticket.
# Try to switch the assignee from the Assign button or edit the assignee field.

h3. Expected Results
The entire username string will be in the same color as what was configured in the Look and Feel settings.

h3. Actual Results
Only the bolded part of the username will be in the new color, the unbolded characters still remain white.
 
h3. Notes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61328].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The "connecting JIRA to SQL Server" documentations do not mention the autoCommit parameter in the JDBC URLs. This parameter is needed to prevent deadlocks as per https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/deadlock-when-running-jira-with-sql-server-283640022.html and so it should be a required configuration in JIRA's dbconfig.xml.

h3. Suggested Solution
Modify the documentation to include {{autoCommit=false}} parameter by default:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira063/connecting-jira-to-sql-server-2012-683541742.html
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA064/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008
fields.summary: Documentation for SQL Server should include setting the autoCommit parameter in JDBC URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61323].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
We see this regularly where we migrate projects from one instance to another. In a lot of cases teams add a condition on create (maybe a field must not be null, etc.) after the project was created and issues populated. In these circumstances we have to amend the workflow to import the old issues and then re-apply. 

h3. Suggested Solution
During project import I want to skip _issue Created_ event generation and 
all corresponding postfunctions and validators.

h3. Note
It can affect data integrity for the project. It might cause issue to be in the wrong state and/or has wrong fields values.

h3. Workaround 
Modify project workflow to disable corresponding postfunctions and validators.
fields.summary: As an Administrator I want to skip postfunctions and validators during project import

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Home preference is not working properly in Firefox and google chrome but working fine in Internet explorer.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA version 7.1.7
 * JIRA version 6.4.13
 * Google Chrome
 * Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Firefox: Options » When Firefox starts » select *Show a blank page*
 # Chrome: Settings » On startup » select *Open the New Tab page*
 # Login to JIRA instance
 # Click on user profile and set issue Navigator as your JIRA Home
 # Logout and close your browser.
 # Open browser and login again.

 
h3. Expected Results

Once login you will be automatically directed to issue navigator page since you have set issue navigator as your JIRA Home as shown in below image.
 !issuenavigator.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

You will be directed to dashboard page once login even though you set your JIRA Home as issue navigator page.
 !Chrome.jpg|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

If user logout and login again via [http://localhost:8080/login.jsp] JIRA Home is working fine but if user logout and login again via [http://localhost:8080/secure/Dashboard.jspa] it will bring the user to dashboard page instead of JIRA Home
h3. Workaround
 # Use Internet Explorer as in internet explorer when you login from [http://localhost:8080/secure/Dashboard.jspa] it will automatically bring user to their preferred JIRA Home page instead of dashboard.
 !IE.jpg|thumbnail!
 # Bookmark the login URL as:
 {{[http://localhost:8080/login.jsp?os_destination=%2Fissues%2F%3Fjql%3D]}} where [http://localhost:8080|http://localhost:8080/] is your JIRA base URL to get directly to Issue Navigator page
fields.summary: JIRA Home preference is not working properly in firefox and google chrome

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61320].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Hide the Components field in the field configuration for any given project.
# Go to the project's admin > Components page.
# Add a component.
# Refresh the page.

h3. Expected results
The component added in step 3 above is still there.

h3. Actual results
JIRA says "You haven't added any components to this project yet". If you try to add the component again, JIRA says it already exists.

h3. Notes
The component is successfully added with a {{POST}} to {{/rest/api/2/component}}, but then immediately does a {{GET}} to {{/rest/projects/1.0/project/<key>/component/<component id>}} which returns 404.
fields.summary: Hiding Components field in field configuration breaks Components page in project admin

Access JIRA from one tab/window at a time.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61305].
  {panel}

When a story or defect gets moved from one project(A) to another project(B), the sprint from A project also gets moved to the B project, and if that sprint in A project gets closed, then there is no option to remove that in B project. 
In the sprint report (velocity chart) Project A sprints will also be shown which is not needed for Project B.
There should be an option provided to remove the sprints when a story or defect gets moved or automatically the sprint should be removed when the story/defect gets moved to different project.

This issue is observed in Jira 7.1.6
fields.summary: When a story or defect gets moved from one project to another project, an option should be provided to remove the sprint

fields.description:
*Summary*

When an admin has configured the outgoing mail for a JIRA server wrongly and he saves it without test, if he invites users, JIRA should not show the pass mark that the invite was successfully sent.

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Configure an Outgoing mail in JIRA using wrong credentials.
#* Save without testing.
# Proceed to invite a user to JIRA.

*Expected Result*
JIRA should alert the admin that something is wrong and invite was not able to be sent since it would get stuck in the mail queue.

*Actual Result*
JIRA would show that email was successfully sent with the green check mark.
fields.summary: Invite User should warn the administrator when the Outgoing mail credentials are incorrect and the email could not be sent

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary

Editing filters to include additional columns ('test' column for example) will add 'test' column to other existing filters.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a few filters with any columns of your liking.
# Add an additional column to any of the filters. 
# Reorder the columns as per attached clip

h3. Expected Results
Only the edited filter will be affected.

h3. Actual Results
Additional column is inserted to other filters as well besides the one you are configuring.
Reordering the column arrangements also affects other filters too

h3.Workaround
No workarounds at the moment
fields.summary: Editing filter columns affects other filter selected columns

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Renaming an LDAP user breaks the avatar if the user was previously from the JIRA Internal Directory 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user in the JIRA internal directory eg. sam 
# Set an Avatar for the user 
 !image-2016-06-03-21-35-40-499.png|thumbnail! 
Create a user in LDAP with the same user anme eg. sam
# Sync the directory and ensure the LDAP directory order is on top of the JIRA internal directory
 !image-2016-06-03-21-39-17-409.png|thumbnail! 
# Rename the user from sam to sammy in the LDAP and sync again
# It will not break yet as the avatar is still displaying for the user ( sammy ) 
 !image-2016-06-03-21-41-56-580.png|thumbnail! 
# Login as sammy ( this is an important step )

h3. Expected Results
The avatar should not break

h3. Actual Results
The Avatar breaks 
 !image-2016-06-03-21-43-17-092.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2016-06-03-21-43-41-601.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
Delete the old username from the JIRA internal directory and the avatar will display again correctly : 
 !image-2016-06-03-21-45-43-967.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Renaming LDAP user breaks Avatar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61295].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When JIRA is trying to write to a file on the file system and does not have sufficient permissions to do so, then it logs a very generic message in the logs : 
{noformat}2016-06-02 19:39:58,969 lexorank-executor-thread-0 ERROR      [service.lexorank.balance.LexoRankBalancingService] java.io.IOException: No such file or directory
java.lang.IllegalStateException: java.io.IOException: No such file or directory
	at net.java.ao.db.FileSystemUtils$1.get(FileSystemUtils.java:43)
	at net.java.ao.db.FileSystemUtils$1.get(FileSystemUtils.java:24)
	at com.google.common.base.Suppliers$MemoizingSupplier.get(Suppliers.java:109)
	at net.java.ao.db.FileSystemUtils.isCaseSensitive(FileSystemUtils.java:50)
	at net.java.ao.db.MySQLDatabaseProvider.isCaseSensitive(MySQLDatabaseProvider.java:189)
.
.
Caused by: java.io.IOException: No such file or directory
	at java.io.UnixFileSystem.createFileExclusively(Native Method)
	at java.io.File.createTempFile(Unknown Source)
	at java.io.File.createTempFile(Unknown Source)
	at net.java.ao.db.FileSystemUtils$1.get(FileSystemUtils.java:29)
	... 84 more{noformat}

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be nice if JIRA adds more information on the path where this action is failing. That would help administrators troubleshoot the problem on their own without even contacting Support.
fields.summary: As an administrator I want better logging for 'java.io.IOException: No such file or directory'

  {panel}

The defect is reproduced on Jira Server 6.3.12, 6.3.14 and 6.4.6. 
Browser Chrome.

Steps to reproduce (should be done +without page refresh+):
# Open an issue in editable status
# Edit Description field via inline editing and save changes
# Transition the issue to non-editable status (prorerty "jira.issue.editable" is set to "false")
# Transition the issue back to editable status
# Try to edit Description field via inline edit

+Expected result:+ It is possible to inline edit Description field and save the changes.
+Actual result:+
* (for Jira Server 6.3.12 and 6.4.6) It is possible to inline edit Description field, but "Save" button does not work. It is possible only to cancel the changes. 
*OR* 
* (for Jira Server 6.3.14) In a very short moment Description field is cleared on its own and switches back to view mode. In issue history appears a record that the field was cleared by the user.

h3. Summary

When uploading an attachment, the generated thumbnail image does not contain EXIF information (e.g. orientation).

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud
* JIRA Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Take a photo with an iPhone in portrait mode
# Upload this photo as an attachment.

h3. Expected Results
The thumbnail contains EXIF information

h3. Actual Results
The thumbnail contains no EXIF information (note that the thumbnail of the attached photo is displayed in the incorrect orientation - if you download it and view the image on your computer, the image is displayed correctly).
 
h3. Notes
This has knock-on effects for the file viewer on mobile devices (as the aspect ratio of the thumbnail is used to display the full image, so although the full image displays in the correct orientation, it's squashed).

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Attachment thumbnails do not preserve EXIF information

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61264].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA can get into a state where most gadgets in the "Add a gadget" dialog on dashboards never load and JIRA displays a message saying "Some gadgets failed to load". Clicking the "Try again" link may or may not work.

h3. Workaround
JIRA Cloud customers should raise a support request at [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com] and reference this bug, and the support team will restart JIRA and increase the maximum amount of memory available to it as a temporary workaround until the bug itself is fixed.

h3. Technical notes
*Current Situation*

The dashboard fetches gadgets in a two-step operation:
# Upon clicking "add gadget" the dashboard directory is loaded and filled with the contents of the call to /rest/config/1.0/directoryitems/local.json. If this call times out (60secs) a retry is available to attempt it again. This is current design and behaviour, if the timeout is reached the "Broken Pipe" exception will be logged, this is again expected behaviour.
# Also, the dashboard will attempt to fetch external gadgets at this time via a background request to /rest/config/1.0/directoryitems/external.json and will notify this to the end user via the "Not all gadgets have loaded" information box on the dashboard. This is not an error, it's normal behaviour. Having said that, getting this timeout frequently in a specific instance might be indicative of some problem in it that would need to be troubleshooted for that customer.

If the aforementioned request to fetch external gadgets times out (60 secs), then you will get the "Some gadgets failed to load" message and a prompt to try again. This is also expected behaviour from JIRA. Having said that, getting this timeout frequently in a specific instance might be indicative of some problem in it that would need to be troubleshooted for that customer. For instance, they might have too many applinks, connectivity to applinked 
instances of JIRA and Confluence might be too slow / etc...

*What can be done now?*
* We can consider bumping the Nginx timeout for these requests.
* We can / probably should consider improving the messaging in the UI, so that what is actually happening is more clear to the end-user and support. I can even spot a spelling mistake in one of the messages 

*What can be done in the longer term?*
The current fetching / retry mechanism is quite naive as it tries to fetch everything in two one-shot requests and completely fails over to retrieve anything if the request(s) fail over. This is specially hurtful when it comes to remote specs. The number of remote specs is proportional to the amount of applinked instances and it will eventually not scale and timeout more and more frequently (this is exacerbated by the overhead of fetching the data from a remote host).
We can redesign the fetching mechanism such that specs are retrieved via a "paging" sort of mechanism (say 5 specs at a time for example) to achieve scalability and reduce the incidence of time-outs.

We can profile the fetching algorithm for a given spec to understand what performance improvements can be done for this operation such that we reduce the calculation time if possible.

Furthermore, as part of other work being undertaken, we are replacing/removing the global cache that holds these gadget specs. I believe that re-architecting these fetching mechanism and the profiling described is a pre-requisite to be able to kill this cache so we need these three things to be done together at the same time.
fields.summary: Make the fetching of Gadget specs more efficient

fields.description:
I am unable to disable minification of my web resources in my JIRA plugin, particularly my javascript and css. This was made using the Atlassian SDK.

Here are the things I've tried that did not work:
# Based on [your documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/development-resources/confluence-developer-faq/how-to-switch-to-non-minified-javascript-for-debugging], I did the following:
** from cmd/powershell: {code}atlas-debug --jvmargs "-Datlassian.webresource.disable.minification=true"{code}
** {code}atlas-debug --jvmargs "-Datlassian.webresource.disable.minification=true"{code}
** {code}atlas-debug --jvmargs "-Datlassian.webresource.disable.minification=true -D -Datlassian.dev.mode=true"{code}
*** take note that {{atlas-debug}} already enables dev mode by default
*** Documentation also says that dev mode enabled should disable minification of web resources by default
** {code}atlas-run --jvmargs "-Datlassian.webresource.disable.minification=true"{code}
** {code}atlas-run--jvmargs "-Datlassian.webresource.disable.minification=true -D -Datlassian.dev.mode=true"{code}
# I tried [this answer|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/3576/how-can-i-disable-the-yui-compressor-when-building-a-jira-plugin] by adding {{<compressResources>false</compressResources>}} to my pom.xml and this didn't work, either.
** I also tried running with step #1 with and without the extra jvm arguments
** This ticket is most definitely related to https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMPS-796 except the instructions here don't solve anything
** My current POM settings for the maven-jira plugin element look like this: {code:xml}           <plugin>
                <groupId>com.atlassian.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-jira-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>${amps.version}</version>
                <extensions>true</extensions>
                <configuration>
                    <productVersion>${jira.version}</productVersion>
                    <productDataVersion>${jira.version}</productDataVersion>
                    <!-- Uncomment to install TestKit backdoor in JIRA. -->
                    <!--
					<pluginArtifacts>
						<pluginArtifact>
							<groupId>com.atlassian.jira.tests</groupId>
							<artifactId>jira-testkit-plugin</artifactId>
							<version>${testkit.version}</version>
						</pluginArtifact>
					</pluginArtifacts>
					-->
                    <enableQuickReload>true</enableQuickReload>
                    <enableFastdev>false</enableFastdev>
                    <compressResources>false</compressResources>
                    <instructions>
                        <Atlassian-Plugin-Key>${atlassian.plugin.key}</Atlassian-Plugin-Key>
                        <!-- Add package to export here -->
                        <Export-Package>com.mmodal.cars.api,</Export-Package>
                        <!-- Add package import here -->
                        <Import-Package>org.springframework.osgi.*;resolution:="optional", org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.*;resolution:="optional", *</Import-Package>
                        <!-- Ensure plugin is spring powered - see https://extranet.atlassian.com/x/xBS9hQ  -->
                        <Spring-Context>*</Spring-Context>
                    </instructions>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>{code}

Why are these not working?

One of the people in my team have suggested to look at where requirejs is being run. However, it's not clear where that is... I am assuming the {{atlassian-plugin.xml}} is the layer that requirejs will work on?

Other relevant info:
* Atlassian SDK Version: 6.2.6 (plugin was created with 6.2.3 however)
* Maven Properties from my plugin's {{pom.xml}}: {code:xml}    <properties>
        <jira.version>6.4.7</jira.version>
        <amps.version>6.1.2</amps.version>
        <plugin.testrunner.version>1.2.3</plugin.testrunner.version>
        <atlassian.spring.scanner.version>1.2.6</atlassian.spring.scanner.version>
        <!-- This key is used to keep the consistency between the key in atlassian-plugin.xml and the key to generate bundle. -->
        <atlassian.plugin.key>${project.groupId}.${project.artifactId}</atlassian.plugin.key>
        <!-- TestKit version 6.x for JIRA 6.x -->
        <testkit.version>6.3.11</testkit.version>
    </properties>{code}

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*

When a user on JIRA 7.X upgrades the HipChat for JIRA plugin to version 7.8.1 and they are using an Oracle database, the following error is thrown extensively in their logs:

{code}
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: ORA-01408: such column list already indexed

        at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError(T4CTTIoer.java:450)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError(T4CTTIoer.java:399)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4C8Oall.processError(T4C8Oall.java:1017)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIfun.receive(T4CTTIfun.java:655)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4C8Oall.doOALL(T4C8Oall.java:566)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CStatement.doOall8(T4CStatement.java:202)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CStatement.doOall8(T4CStatement.java:45)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CStatement.executeForRows(T4CStatement.java:933)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.doExecuteWithTimeout(OracleStatement.java:1075)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.executeUpdateInternal(OracleStatement.java:1640)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.executeUpdate(OracleStatement.java:1603)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatementWrapper.executeUpdate(OracleStatementWrapper.java:308)
        at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingStatement.java:234)
        at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingStatement.java:234)
        at net.java.ao.DatabaseProvider.executeUpdate(DatabaseProvider.java:2246)
        at net.java.ao.DatabaseProvider.executeUpdateForAction(DatabaseProvider.java:2302)
{code}

The irony is hipchat is not connected to JIRA and that table does not exist until you connect a hipchat room to a project.

h3. *Steps To Reproduce*

# Setup a JIRA instance of version 7.X
# Upgrade the hipchat plugin to version 7.8.1

h3. *Expected Result*

* Nothing special should be seen in the atlassian-jira log file when you open it.

h3. *Actual Result*

* The log file is flooded with the error above.

h3. *Workaround 1 (If you do not use HipChat)*

_Disabling the HipChat plugin to avoid the error flooding your logs._

# Go to {{Admin > Add-ons >Manage Add-ons}} page.
# Disable the hipchat for JIRA plugin.

h3. *Workaround 2 (Best all round solution)*

_Downgrading to an earlier version of the plugin_

# Stop JIRA.
# Go to {{JIRA HOME > plugins > installed-plugins}} folder.
# Delete the following plugins:
#* base-hipchat-integration-plugin-7.8.1.jar
#* base-hipchat-integration-plugin-api-7.8.1.jar
#* hipchat-for-jira-plugin-7.8.1.jar
# Restart JIRA.
When you restart JIRA, it would re-install the bundled version of the hipchat plugin.
fields.summary: HipChat causing "ORA-01408: such column list already indexed"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61250].
{panel}
h5. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Log into JIRA
 # Log out from JIRA

h5. Expected Results:
 * The URL shown in the address bar does not show the {{atl_token}} value

h5. Actual Results:
 * The URL shown in the address bar shows the {{atl_token}} value

h5. Impact

After checking with the security teams, this appears to be a low risk problem (as the token is invalid after logging out). However, we should probably not have tokens visible in the URL
fields.summary: JIRA puts a user's XSRF token in various resources.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61248].
  {panel}

Hello
Many of my users would like to see their notifications from Jira itself, and stop receiving emails. 

*It only make sense to surf to a system and see your latest updates there.*

Sure, I can add the Activity Stream to the dashboard, and also the Assigned To Me gadget, and maybe a Filter Results gadget to display anything that was updated in the last day - but this is too much reading to do just to find out what actually changed or if anyone sent me a comment.

I think it would be wise to add *a visibility of the same notification mechanism*, to a gadget to be displayed on a dashboard or maybe consider adding an icon for notification (like in Facebook, or like Jitter (https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.jitterplugin.jira.jitter-notify/server/overview) use to provide, and is not supported for jira 7.x).

Thank you
Ayelet
fields.summary: Notifications inside Jira, not in emails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61246].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Creating issue links to projects for which I do not have Link Issues permissions

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 projects in JIRA: project A and project B
# Project A is using default permission scheme, where Link Issues permission is set to Any Logged In user
# Project B is using a modified permission scheme where no role has the permissions to Link Issues
# Find an Issue in Project A, and link it to any issue in project B

h3. Expected Results
Either result would be expected here:
* JIRA creates the link on issue A, which is allowed per the permissions above, but does not create a link on issue in project B.
* Or JIRA warns user that a reciprocal link can't be created on Issue B due to permissions (either way when we look at Issue B, we should not see any links)

h3. Actual Results
JIRA creates the link on both issues, despite project B's permission scheme that does not allow any user to link issues
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
none


h3.Original Description
{quote}
This happened in a single-server setup, I had two projects, Project A and Project B. My user only had the Link Issues permission in Project A.

I then tried to create an issue link from an issue in Project A to one in Project B which worked fine. I expected the issue link operation to fail b/c I just created an issue link on an issue of a project where I don't have the Link Issues permission. That just feels like breaking the permission restrictions.
{quote}
fields.summary: I can create issue links to projects for which I do not have Link Issues permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61244].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 27nd September 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hi Everyone,

This issue is fixed in Both JIRA Cloud and JIRA Server.
* JIRA Cloud users have already got their instances updated.
* JIRA Server users have to upgrade to JIRA 7.2.2 Server which is now available to download at https://www.atlassian.com/download .

Thanks,
Ignat Alexeyenko
JIRA Bugmaster.

 
{panel}


h3. Summary

When using the Excel (CSV, Current Fields) Export option, column order does not match what was selected in the WebUI and the Issue ID field is included (though it was not selected).


h3. Environment
 * JIRA v1000.25.1 Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform a JIRA Issue Search
 # Configure custom Columns and Column Order
 # Export Issues to CSV using Export > Excel (CSV, Current Fields)


h3. Expected Results

Downloaded CSV file only shows Columns (and results) based on what is selected in the WebUI


h3. Actual Results

No Errors in logs.
 The IssueID field (column) is added
 Order does not keep to what was configured in the WebUI
 Shown in screenshot:

||WebUI|Issue Type, Issue Key, Summary, Assignee, Reporter, Priority, Status, Resolution, Created Date, Updated Date, Affects Version/s, Links|
||CSV Export|Summary, Issue Key, *Issue id*, Issue Type, Status, Priority, Resolution, Assignee, Reporter, Created, Updated, Outward issue link (Blocks)|

!WebvsCSV.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

Appears that the Excel (CSV) Export options were added in April 19th but listed as a Service Desk Feature: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/What's+New#What'sNew-servicedesk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/What's+New#What%27sNew-servicedesk]
h3. Workaround

* As a workaround you can use the Export HTML Report (current field/all fields). You can then edit the name of the file from <filename>.html to <filename>.xls and it should open up in your spreadsheet program. You may run into this bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-61891
fields.summary: Export to Excel CSV Current Fields Does Not Show Same Order as WebUI

fields.description:
We can't use JIRA's Created vs Resolved gadget in other applications, like Confluence, because someone typo-ed the name of the function in a call to getPreferences().

My PMs reported that this breakage appeared in Confluence after I upgraded our JIRA from 6.3.9 to 7.1.6. When they try to add a JIRA Created vs Resolved gadget to a confluence page, the preview pane is blank and they can't finish the configuration that would allow them to insert the gadget.

With Chrome's developer tools, I found that an error on the page when I chose the gadget and just after the browser tried to render the preview panel in the gadget config screen. The error is "Uncaught ReferenceError: getPrefences is not defined." Which makes perfect sense because the function is named getPrefe*re*nces, not getPrefences

   and then looked in the source and at line 372 in file
.../jira-components/jira-plugins/jira-gadgets-plugin/src/main/resources/gadgets/createdvsresolved-gadget.xml

I see this:
     var preferences = getPrefences(gadget);
and it should be
     var preferences = getPreferences(gadget);

It's missing the crucial "re" sylable.  :-)
fields.summary: Correct misspelled getPrefences() to getPreferences() in file createdvsresolved-gadget.xml

PermissionManager permissionManager = ComponentAccessor.getPermissionManager();
Collection<Group> availableGroups = permissionManager.getAllGroups(Permissions.WORK_ISSUE, projectManager.getProjectByCurrentKey("TEST"));

fields.description:
Hi there,

we have the on premise enterprise version of JIRA. 

When we hit 
https://xxx/rest/api/latest/search?jql=key%3D%27TICKET-1%27
on a ticket where the reporter user account is deleted, the reporter field is returned as NULL.

However, when we hit the specific ticket via the issues endpoint:
https://xxx/rest/api/2/issue/TICKET-1 
We get the correct reporter.

The exptected behaviour would be to retrieve the reporter in both cases, or NULL for both. But not a mixed result depending on the way you try to get the issues.
fields.summary: [REST API] Reporter not returned in /search/ but in /issues/ when user is deleted.

h3. Description
The current JIRA does not have the option to link issue to confluence page in issue screens (e.g Edit screen, and issue creation screen). The *Linked Issues* field from the Edit screen, and issue creation screen are only able to link JIRA internal issues.

The only way to link issue to confluence page is from *More* >> *Link* >> *Confluence page*.

h3. Suggestion
- Create a field to link issue to confluence page.
- Adding a option to link issue to a confluence page from Linked Issue field.
fields.summary: Add option to Linked Issue field to link issue to confluence page in screens field.
